passages.text: ASIA- PACIFIC | Asia Insights
On Clients' Minds - Asia

We are pleased to present a selection of research from across the region that was of greatest interest to readers over the past week. This includes select top- down pieces, stock and sector research, plus the most- read research from our Asia co- brand partners.

India Strategy We met several very senior bureaucrats/experts in Delhi. The upcoming GST rate rationalization has been more than a year in making and should aid consumption, without much fiscal hit. The Govt is preparing for the worst case US tariff situation though hopes of improvement exist. India/China relationship improving, but that's going on for more than a year and is part of a longer process. Govt. focus is on a renewed reforms push with action to be visible soon.

Japan Quantitative Strategy Japan's 2025 AGM season saw a record 53 shareholder proposals in the Topix 100 universe, up sharply from 11 in 2024 (and 22/6 in 2023/22), signaling a bold new era of investor activism. Proposals focused on governance, board composition, environmental issues, and performance- linked compensation policies. We highlight companies where support for management- backed board and chairman nominations declined, potentially signaling structural change ahead.

Franchise Report: India Pharmaceuticals (CRDMO industry is at an inflection point, evolving from quasi- chemical firms to strategic partners for innovators, backed by capabilities and geographic diversification. We believe China+1 is a structural story that can drive high- teen revenue CAGR for the next decade. Our pipeline analysis reveals a healthy molecules buildup for Sai, Piramal, Divi's and Cohanec. We initiate coverage on Cohanec with Buy, upgrade Divi's to Buy, and our top pick is Sai.

Bajaj Finance We hosted Bajaj Finance's Chairman, VC- MD, CFO- COO & Dy. CEO for roadshow. Mgt clarified that while SME segment is seeing some pressure, stress isn't as high as feared & credit cost for FY26 can be near guided range of 185- 195bps of loans & loan growth can be 23- 24% YoY. Rajeev's role as MD is till Mar- 28 & thereafter there would be new CEO from internal candidates. Bajaj's among few large caps with +20% growth and ROE, so it stays among our top- pick.

China Tech US President Trump's offer to lift the ban on H20 to entice China to relax rare earth export controls has backfired, as China has already banned H20 purchases "until further notice." The "chip for rare earth" strategy failed. But China is likely more interested in "rare earths for WFE," as its LT plan is to make its own AI chips to avoid getting "addicted" to US tech. China's chip imports still exceed its oil imports. Western WFE stocks could benefit.

China Tech China's smartphone shipment in Jun saw another month of DD fall at 14%, driven by \(\sim 11\% / \sim 31\%\) drop in local brands/iPhone. On a rolling 6- month basis, we set iPhone's inventory days have fallen by \(\sim 20\) vs \(\sim 14\) for Android. While this is positive for the industry, deterioration in sell through in July means shipment will unlikely recover soon. The pressure on Android is still much bigger than on iPhone. The iPhone 17 launch in Sep will soon drive shipment recovery.

Aurelia Metals uEBITDA was broadly in line with our and VAE when accounting for \(\) 7.85\(mn non- recurring biodiversity credits sales. Lower D&A was partially offset by higher interest expense. Planned FY26 debt refi will unlock liquidity, while Fed's shift to commercial production will
US Insights: What You Need to Know  Europe Insights: In Case You Missed It...  On Clients' Minds - Japan
normalise the P&L and commence depreciating. Ramp- up at Fed, and growth at Peak & Great Cobar is clouded by lingering Resource uncertainty at Fed. Reiterate BUY, PT AUD0.28.

Coles Coles continues to fire, with strong margin & robust 4Q sales momentum persisting into FY26. Full picture won't be known until WOW reports tomorrow, but performance appears to be driven by both execution & improving market. COL enjoys numerous margin tailwinds into FY26, allowing it to continue to reinvest in price/service, and still print another record margin, particularly with political focus on supermarket pricing abating. Hold given full valuation.

Australia Technology & Information Services As both companies celebrate their 25th year anniversary of being listed on the ASX, we explore the thesis that OCL (UNPF) should command a similar valuation to TNE (BUY). We remain unconvinced.

Hengrui 3 BDs contributed RMB2bn income in 1H25, and we are confident on Hengrui's R&D capability to continuously deliver high- quality BDs. Promising assets incl. DPP- 1, CDK4, HFR3/C- Met ADC, CD3/DLL3 TCE, Nav1.8. New target of 25% 3- yr rev. CAGR for innovative drugs is backed by new BBU and ESOP. Maintain Buy and raise PT to RMB6.

China Tech China's July WFE imports grew 14%, two consecutive months of double- digit growth, driven mainly by etching (162%), then ion implanting (44%) and deposition (25%). Litho imports fell 33%. The fastest- growing sources of imports remain Malaysia (10x YoY), Singapore (43% YoY) and Japan (30% YoY). YTD China's WFE imports grew only 1%, driven entirely by etching (55% YoY). We believe memory fabs stockpiling for fear of more US sanctions is the key growth driver.

Viva Energy 1Q25 appears to have marked the bottom for Convenience with signs of stabilization in 2Q. This sets a baseline for the business, and there should be upside from further synergies & OTR conversion uplift. However, we believe consensus is still far too optimistic, & we don't see a path to the \(\) 500m\(EBITDA target, which leaves us on the sidelines despite undemanding valuation. Prefer ALD, given proposed EG integration & U - GO conversions carry less execution risk.

Taiwan Tech Since the launch of Ray- Ban Meta smart glasses, the product has received strong market acclaim and quickly become a fashionable wearable accessory in Europe and the US markets. As AI generative technologies are maturing, AI glasses are able to connect to external devices such as smartphones via Wi- Fi or Bluetooth, enabling interactions with users and providing functions such as object recognition, real- time translation, and AI- powered Q&A. Consumer interest in wearable devices with AI capabilities continue to rise. In addition to Meta's partnership with EssilorLuxottica, the eyewear manufacturer behind brands such as Ray- Ban and Oakley, the existing AR smart glasses market is likely Ray- Neo and Rokid have integrated large language models (LLMs) into their AI glasses offerings. Google is also partnering with Samsung, Gentle Monster, and Warby Parker to jointly develop smart glasses powered by its Gemini AI assistant. In China's market, smartphone brands and internet tech companies including Huawei, Xiaomi, OPPO, Alibaba, and Baidu have already released products or prototypes with their own AI models. HTC (2498 TT) recently launched its first AI glasses, VIVE Eagle. Furthermore, Meta's first AI glasses equipped with a display, reportedly to be named either "Hypernova" or "Meta Celeste," may debut by the end of 2025. Industry sources also claim that Samsung and Apple are developing their own AI glasses, with releases expected around 2025- 26.

KT We maintain BUY and TP of KRW70,000 on KT. Investment highlights include: (1) hopes for the ongoing value- up program, (2) strong growth potential of the B2B AX business, and (3) operational efficiency improvement from communication wing's AI adoption.

The Boeing Company After my 1st week of marketing in the UK since 2019, one theme stood out: local investors are buyers of Airbus > BA on perceived FCF quality. At pre- pandemic peaks, BA earned \(13.6BB of FCF in '18 (BCA FCF/delivery of\) 11.6MM) to Airbus' peak \(11.4MM/aircraft

in '19. Our BA FCF sets of \(8.5BB\) in '27, \(11.0BB\) in '28, and \(12.5BB\) in '29 assume depressed BCA cash margins until 2030, w/ potential pull- fwdom ++ build rates, px & concessions, and W/ C leverage.

North America Metals & Mining There has been a notable change in the performance of gold equities and valuations pre and post 2Q results. 2Q results marked the second consecutive quarter of wide margins and strong free cash flow, likely enough of a trend for generalists to take note. This, along with a recent net inflow into the GDX, albeit small, suggests to us generalists have slowly started to re- enter the sector, but not yet in a meaningful way.

Europe Midcaps Whilst tariffs have held back a broader SMID revival, we already witnessed signs of a trend reversal, following the longest underperformance on record. The anticipation of the German stimulus and a potential ceasefire provides a positive set- up for Europe and re- rating potential for growth- related sectors and cyclical names. In this note we take a fresh look at investment ideas for the current market phase, we change 6 ratings and highlight 15 top picks.

Krones A global leader in packaging and bottling technology, Krones operates at the intersection of structural beverage growth, sustainability- driven investment, and automation. With clear strategy, strong execution, and a robust financial profile, we believe it is well positioned to grow ahead of the market. On 9x EV/EBIT '26, we anticipate a rerating underpinned by solid earnings growth and new product launches at the CMD in September. Initiate at Buy, €175 PT.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.

instrument is denominated in a currency other than the investor's home currency, a change in exchange rates may adversely affect the price of, value of, or income derived from the financial instrument described in this report. To the extent prices are shown in non- US currency, please note that our local currency price targets are based on a currency conversion using an exchange rate as of the prior trading day (unless otherwise noted). Should there be fluctuations in the exchange rate after this date, that will affect the non- US target prices and should no longer be relied upon. In addition, investors in securities such as ADRs, whose values are affected by the currency of the underlying security, effectively assume currency risk.
